fields.value: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS): Fall Enrollment Analysis, 1990

authorName.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Education. National Center for Education Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This collection contains two data files for the 1990 IPEDS  Fall Enrollment survey. Part 1, Institutional Characteristics,  contains the institutional characteristics data for all institutions  by level of study, type and control of institution, affiliation, and  offered degrees. Part 2, Enrollment Data by Race/Ethnicity, contains enrollment data by racial and ethnic background.

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB3737.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS and SPSS data definition statements;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The codebook for this collection is provided as a  Portable Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed  by Adobe Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader  software, such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to  obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

seriesName.value: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS) Series

value: All (9,756) postsecondary institutions in operation in 1990 in the United States and its outlying areas.

fields.value: The Fall Enrollment Survey was sent to the universe of  accredited and to all non-accredited institutions offering a  bachelor's, master's, doctor's or first-professional degree.  Additional enrollment data was collected from the remaining  non-accredited institutions via the Consolidated Survey. The  Consolidated Survey was sent to all remaining non-accredited 4-year,  2-but-less-than-4-year, and public less-than-2-year institutions and to a sample of private less-than-2-year schools.
Checked for undocumented or out-of-range codes.
